Title: Google Reveals Two New Web Crawlers
Description: Google has launched two new web crawlers: GoogleOther-Image and GoogleOther-Video. These crawlers are designed to specifically crawl images and videos on the web.

Title: Why advertisers can no longer trust Google
Description: This article explores the reasons why some advertisers are losing trust in Google, citing concerns about transparency, data privacy, and the dominance of Google's advertising platforms.

Title: EU asks Microsoft to provide information about Bing’s generative AI features
Description: The EU has requested Microsoft to provide details on the potential risks associated with generative AI features in its Bing search engine, particularly in relation to the spread of misinformation and deepfakes.

Title: Order with Google integration is going away at the end of June
Description: Google is discontinuing its 'Order with Google' integration for food delivery services like Uber Eats, DoorDash, and GrubHub at the end of June.

Title: How to remove your content from the Google AI Overviews
Description: This article provides instructions on how to remove your website's content from appearing in Google's AI-generated overviews, using techniques like the 'nosnippet' tag and other content control options.

Title: Google Ads AI summaries may be rolling out?
Description: Google is reportedly rolling out AI-powered summaries for Google Ads campaigns. This feature is intended to provide advertisers with concise and insightful overviews of their campaign performance.

Title: TikTok now testing 60-minute video uploads
Description: TikTok is experimenting with longer video uploads, allowing some users to post videos up to 60 minutes in length. This move could significantly impact content creation and user engagement on the platform.

Title: Google Locks Down Complaints Of Image Thumbnails Not Showing In Search
Description: Google has locked a support thread addressing complaints about missing image thumbnails in search results. The company acknowledges the issue but has stopped providing specific responses, stating that the team is aware of the problem.

Title: Mikhail Parakhin, Former Microsoft Bing Head, Joins Perplexity Advisor Board
Description: Mikhail Parakhin, former head of Bing Search and Microsoft Advertising, has joined the advisory board of Perplexity, an AI-powered search startup.

Title: ChatGPT To Surface Reddit Content Via Partnership With OpenAI
Description: OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT, has partnered with Reddit to integrate Reddit content into ChatGPT's responses. This partnership will grant ChatGPT access to Reddit's vast dataset, potentially enhancing its ability to generate more comprehensive and relevant answers.

Title: EU Demands Information from Microsoft on AI Risks in Bing
Description: The European Commission has given Microsoft a deadline of May 27 to provide information on risks associated with generative AI features in its Bing search engine, threatening fines for non-compliance.

Title: Microsoft PC Manager Promotes Bing as Default Search Engine
Description: Microsoft's PC Manager app suggests switching to Bing as the default search engine as a solution for 'repairing' Windows devices.

Title: Former Bing AI Head Joins Perplexity Advisor Board
Description: Mikhail Parakhin, former head of Bing Search and Microsoft Advertising, joins the advisory board of AI search startup Perplexity.

Title: Google Introduces New Web Crawlers
Description: Google has launched two new web crawlers, GoogleOther-Image and GoogleOther-Video, indicating possible changes in how Google crawls and indexes visual content.

Title: Order with Google Integration Ending in June
Description: Google's 'Order with Google' integration for food delivery services like Uber Eats, DoorDash, and Grubhub will be discontinued at the end of June.

Title: Google Ads AI Summaries Rolled Out
Description: Google Ads is introducing AI-powered summaries to provide advertisers with concise overviews of their campaign performance.

Title: ChatGPT to Integrate Reddit Content
Description: OpenAI and Reddit have partnered to bring Reddit content to ChatGPT and other AI tools through Reddit's Data API, providing access to a vast dataset for AI development.

Title: TikTok Testing 60-Minute Video Uploads
Description: TikTok is experimenting with longer video uploads, allowing users to create videos up to 60 minutes in length.

Title: EU Commission gives Microsoft 10 days to hand over Bing AI documents
Description: The European Commission has given Microsoft a legally binding deadline of May 27 to supply documents concerning the use of generative artificial intelligence (AI) in its Bing search engine. The order concerns two features: 'Copilot in Bing,' a multipurpose system that can create text and images based on prompts from the user, and 'Image Creator.'

Title: Aleyda Solis expresses concern over negative feedback surrounding Google's AI Overviews
Description: Digital marketing expert Aleyda Solis tweeted about the overwhelming negative feedback for Google's AI Overviews in the US. She highlighted that users, including those outside the SEO community, are installing Chrome extensions to hide AI Overviews due to the lack of an opt-out option.

Title: OpenAI and Reddit partner to bring Reddit content to ChatGPT
Description: OpenAI and Reddit have announced a partnership to bring Reddit content to ChatGPT and other OpenAI products. The partnership will also bring new AI tools to Reddit and make OpenAI a Reddit advertising partner. This move will give ChatGPT access to a massive amount of data from Reddit, potentially improving its ability to generate human-quality text.
